subject: Programming
title: The First Computer Bug
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The First Computer Bug.

hook.text: In 1947, a Harvard computer stopped working. The cause was literally a moth stuck in a relay.

buildup.text: Grace Hopper's team taped the moth into the logbook and labeled it 'first actual case of bug found.'

discovery.text: The term 'bug' predates computers, but this incident cemented it in programming culture.

twist.text: Today, software bugs cost the global economy over $1.7 trillion per year.

climax.text: A tiny insect became the mascot for the biggest ongoing problem in technology.

punchline.text: One moth started a trillion-dollar problem.

quiz.question: Where was the first literal computer bug found?
